title: MediMind Triage
subtitle: Gemini-Powered Multi-Agent Orchestration for Secure Medical Triage
description:
MediMind Triage solves the dual crisis of physician burnout and data privacy by moving advanced medical intelligence directly to the secure browser environment. Built entirely using Google AI Studio’s Vibe Coding, this application is a client-side Multi-Agent Orchestration System powered by Gemini 3.0 Pro.

Instead of a generic chatbot, MediMind features a unique Adaptive UX that transforms based on the user:

For Patients : A calming, voice-first experience. Using the Web Speech API and Gemini’s natural language capabilities, patients can dictate symptoms and upload photos of visible injuries (e.g., skin rashes) for instant visual analysis.

For Doctors : A high-fidelity, glassmorphism-styled dashboard that synthesizes complex data streams.

The Privacy Agent 🛡️: Automatically detects and redacts PII (Personally Identifiable Information) in real-time, ensuring HIPAA-compliant data handling before any external processing.

The Research Agent 📚: leverages Google Search Grounding to fetch live, peer-reviewed studies from PubMed, validating diagnostic suggestions against current medical literature.

The Clinical Agent 🩺: A Multimodal engine that fuses simulated IoT Vitals (Heart Rate, ECG), patient notes, and uploaded medical imaging (X-Rays/MRIs) to provide a diagnosis. Crucially, it includes an XAI (Explainable AI) layer, detailing exactly why a conclusion was reached to build clinician trust.

MediMind Triage demonstrates that complex, secure, and multimodal medical software can be built without heavy backend infrastructure, defining the next generation of accessible digital health.
keywords: medical, agent, medimind, data, triage, privacy, secure, built, using, google

title: RuralMed AI: Bridging the Specialist Gap with Multimodal Reasoning
subtitle: A clinical decision support system that addresses medical specialist shortages in rural and underserved areas.
description:
Track: Health  
Team: Zulfikar

RuralMed AI is a clinical decision support system that addresses medical specialist shortages in rural and underserved areas. General practitioners in remote locations frequently operate without timely access to radiologists or dermatologists, which can result in diagnostic delays or preventable patient transfers.

The application uses Gemini 3 Pro's multimodal capabilities to analyze medical images (X-rays, CT/MRI scans, dermatological photographs, retinal images) in combination with structured patient information including symptoms, vital signs, and medical history.

The system performs clinical reasoning by validating image quality, identifying visual abnormalities, and correlating findings with patient data. It generates structured assessments that include triage recommendations, differential diagnoses with supporting rationale, visual annotations of abnormalities, and clinical guidance for the attending physician.

The application was developed using Google AI Studio to demonstrate how multimodal AI models can improve diagnostic access in resource-limited healthcare settings.

🎥 Video Demo: https://youtu.be/fPEp7LDXIZo 
🚀 Try the App: https://ai.studio/apps/drive/11InjgGwxNbztb5dk-Ge0r8xK7x_EGWGb?fullscreenApplet=true

Rural healthcare facilities often lack specialist availability. Patients presenting with abnormal chest radiographs or concerning dermatological findings may face weeks-long delays for specialist consultation. Local physicians, typically general practitioners, require immediate diagnostic support to make critical decisions about patient transfers, emergency interventions, or local treatment protocols. Delayed specialist access can adversely affect patient outcomes.

RuralMed AI functions as a multimodal diagnostic support tool that integrates visual and textual clinical data. The system replicates aspects of specialist clinical reasoning by analyzing complete patient presentations rather than isolated data points.
keywords: clinical, diagnostic, system, patient, medical, reasoning, specialist, visual, data, support

title: Guardian Eye: AI Autonomous Response Drone
subtitle: Voice-activated emergency surveillance system bridging the gap between distress and police arrival using Gemini AI.
description:
Guardian Eye: Bridging the Gap in Emergency Response
The Reality
In the terrifying moments of a theft or assault, time distorts. While police response times can average over 10 minutes, for a victim, those minutes feel like a lifetime. That gap between the distress call and the arrival of help is when people are most vulnerable. We asked: What if help could arrive in seconds?

The Vision
Guardian Eye is a web-based simulation of a rapid-response autonomous drone system. Think of it as an immediate "first responder" that provides eyes on the scene instantly. It doesn’t replace the police; it bridges the gap, offering immediate deterrence and a digital witness when it matters most.

How the Story Unfolds
Imagine you are walking alone at night and sense danger. You don't have time to dial a number or explain your location.

The Cry for Help: You simply speak a trigger word to your phone "Help Help" or "Choor Choor" (Thief Thief).

The Immediate Response: Your phone, running the Guardian Eye User App, instantly locks onto your GPS coordinates and broadcasts a silent distress signal.

The Launch: At the Command Center, the system wakes up. A simulated drone launches from the nearest station, its path automatically calculated to reach you fastest, avoiding obstacles along the way.

Eyes on the Ground: Within moments, the drone arrives. It doesn’t just record; it sees. Using Gemini AI, it identifies threats (people, weapons) and announces its presence, warning perpetrators that authorities have been notified.

Powered by Intelligence (The Tech Stack)
We built Guardian Eye to simulate a future where hardware and AI work together seamlessly.

The Brain (Gemini 2.5 Flash): The drone uses the user's camera to analyze the scene in real-time. It provides a tactical HUD that identifies objects and potential threats with high confidence. It also gives the drone a voice, generating dynamic warnings to de-escalate the situation.

The Nervous System (React & TypeScript): The app simu
keywords: drone, guardian, help, response, time, your, when, most, system, immediate
